abstract.p: Dr Matthew Menken letter on Edmund L Andrews September 24 travel article notes health risks and advantages of using saunas (S)

block.p: To the Editor: Saunas may be relaxing, restful and invigorating, as Edmund L. Andrews suggests in his article about Finland, ''Sauna-of-the-Month Club'' (Sept. 24). But the absence of warning signs should not lead travelers to conclude that there are no risks.

Saunas eliminate salt through the skin. Doctors have known for years that excess salt in the body can raise blood pressure, and have advised low-salt diets and diuretics when appropriate for hypertension. Exercise, saunas, or steam rooms can also eliminate excess salt, provided the exercise or thermal exposure results in sweating. Sometimes medications and unpleasant dietary limitations can be avoided by regular sweating.
